intro: Pyrenaria jonquieriana subsp. multisepala, commonly known as the multiseptate pyrenaria, is a rare and specialized member of the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive floral morphology, particularly the multiple sepals that give it its subspecific name. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in montane regions, often in shaded forest understories. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and arranged in a compact, shrub-like form. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanically significant but poorly understood species.
